titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow insurance companies to be consolidated with noninsurance companies.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 6/23/1987--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to delete language excluding life insurance companies from the definition of "includible corporation," thus permitting such companies to be part of an affiliated group for purposes of filing a consolidated income tax return.
